title: Food & Restaurants
description: Learn vocabulary for ordering food and dining at restaurants.

words.example: Can I see the menu, please?
I have a reservation for 7 PM.
For the main course, I'll have steak.
The chocolate cake is our best dessert.
Can I have the bill, please?
The portions here are very big.
What ingredients are in this dish?
Can I get a refill on my coffee?
The chef prepared a special dish.
This soup has a rich flavor.
words.mnemonic: flavor sounds like 'flavor' - the taste of food

words.example: Would you like to taste this wine?
The food is too bland. It needs salt.
Can I have the recipe for this cake?
words.exampleMeaning: 이 케이크 레시피를 알려주실 수 있나요?

words.example: We offer free delivery for orders over $20.
Do you have any food allergies?

words.mnemonic: tender = 부드러워서 teeth + enter (이가 쉽게 들어간다)

words.example: I need a snack between meals.
words.mnemonic: snack = small + quick (빠르게 먹는 작은 음식)

words.example: What did you have for breakfast?
words.mnemonic: breakfast = break(깨다) + fast(단식) → 밤새 단식을 깬다

words.example: Would you like to join us for dinner?
The hotel has a breakfast buffet.
words.mnemonic: buffet = 마음껏 먹을 수 있는 뷔페

words.example: You can order à la carte.
words.mnemonic: à la carte = 카드(card)처럼 메뉴판에서 선택

words.example: Would you like a side dish with that?
words.mnemonic: side dish = 메인 옆(side)에 나오는 접시(dish)

words.example: The soup of the day is tomato soup.

exercises.question: What do you ask for after eating?
exercises.explanation: You ask for the bill when you want to pay.

exercises.question: I'd like my steak _____. Not too cooked. (medium)
exercises.explanation: Medium means cooked to a middle level.

exercises.question: What is food you eat before the main course?
exercises.explanation: An appetizer is a small dish before the main meal.

exercises.question: I'm _____ to shellfish. I can't eat it. (allergic)
exercises.explanation: Allergic means having a bad reaction to something.

exercises.question: What do you give to the waiter for good service?
exercises.explanation: A tip is extra money for good service.

exercises.question: Match with Korean:
exercises.explanation: Match food terms with Korean meanings.

exercises.question: Do you have _____ options? I don't eat meat. (vegetarian)
Who prepares food in a restaurant?
exercises.explanation: A chef is the professional cook.

exercises.question: What do you _____? (recommend)
exercises.explanation: To recommend is to suggest something good.

exercises.question: What is 'dessert'?
exercises.explanation: Dessert is sweet food at the end of a meal.

exercises.question: I have a _____ for two at 8 PM. (reservation)
exercises.explanation: A reservation is a booking in advance.

exercises.question: What is 'for takeout'?
exercises.explanation: Takeout means food to take away.

exercises.question: Can I see the _____, please? (menu)
exercises.explanation: A menu lists all available food and drinks.

exercises.question: What does 'refill' mean?
exercises.explanation: Refill means to fill your drink again.

exercises.question: What _____ are in this soup? (ingredients)
exercises.explanation: Ingredients are items used to make food.

exercises.question: 이 수프는 풍부한 맛이 있습니다.
answer: This soup has a rich flavor.
exercises.explanation: Use 'flavor' to describe the taste quality.

exercises.question: Would you like to taste this wine?
exercises.explanation: Taste means to try or sample food/drink.

exercises.question: Bland means very spicy and flavorful.
exercises.explanation: False. Bland means tasteless or lacking flavor.

exercises.question: What type of food is Italian, French, or Chinese?
exercises.explanation: Cuisine refers to the style of cooking from a country or region.

exercises.question: Can I have the _____ for this cake? I want to make it at home. (recipe)
exercises.explanation: A recipe is the instructions for cooking.

exercises.question: Which word rhymes with 'ergy'?
exercises.explanation: Allergy ends with the same sound as 'energy'.

exercises.question: Order: is / meat / very / tender / The
우리는 오직 신선한 재료만 사용합니다.
exercises.explanation: Fresh means recently made or picked.

exercises.question: A waitress is a male server.
exercises.explanation: False. A waitress is a female server.

exercises.question: What does a restaurant do with food?
This is my favorite _____. (dish)
exercises.explanation: A dish is a prepared item of food.

exercises.question: Complete: Enjoy your _____!
exercises.explanation: 'Enjoy your meal' is a common restaurant phrase.

exercises.question: Which word has a long 'ee' sound?
exercises.explanation: Meal is pronounced /miːl/ with a long vowel.

exercises.question: Order: snack / I / meals / between / need / a
exercises.answer: I need a snack between meals.
exercises.explanation: A snack is a small amount of food between main meals.

exercises.question: What did you have for breakfest?
exercises.answer: What did you have for breakfast?

exercises.question: Would you like to join us for dinner?
Brunch is a combination of breakfast and lunch.
What is a meal where you can eat as much as you want?
You can order _____. Choose from the menu individually. (à la carte)
exercises.explanation: À la carte means ordering individual items.

exercises.question: Complete: What's today's _____?
exercises.explanation: 'Today's special' is a common restaurant phrase.

exercises.question: Which word has a silent 't' at the end?
Order: a / like / side / Would / you / dish
exercises.answer: Would you like a side dish?
exercises.explanation: Side dishes accompany the main course.

exercises.question: The soop of the day is tomato soup.
exercises.answer: The soup of the day is tomato soup.

exercises.question: 시저 샐러드 주세요.
answer: Can I have a Caesar salad?
exercises.explanation: Ordering a salad at a restaurant.

exercises.question: Seasoning is used to add flavor to food.
exercises.explanation: True. Seasoning adds taste to dishes.

exercises.question: This dish needs more _____. (seasoning)
exercises.explanation: Seasoning improves the taste of food.

exercises.question: Which is correct?
exercises.explanation: Both 'rich flavor' and 'rich taste' are correct.

exercises.question: Order: love / Italian / I / cuisine
exercises.explanation: Expressing preference for a type of food.

exercises.question: Can I get a refil on my coffee?
exercises.answer: Can I get a refill on my coffee?
exercises.explanation: The correct spelling is 'refill' with double 'l'.

exercises.question: Can I have the recipe for this cake?
answer: 이 케이크 레시피를 알려주실 수 있나요?

exercises.question: Delivery means you must eat at the restaurant.
exercises.explanation: False. Delivery brings food to your location.

exercises.question: If you cannot eat peanuts, you have a peanut _____.
exercises.explanation: An allergy is a bad reaction to certain foods.

exercises.question: We offer free _____ for orders over $20. (delivery)
exercises.explanation: Delivery is the service of bringing food.

exercises.question: Complete: food _____
exercises.explanation: Both 'food allergy' and 'food delivery' are common.

exercises.question: Order: is / meat / very / The / tender
Do you have any food allergys?
exercises.answer: Do you have any food allergies?

exercises.question: Fresh ingredients are old and not good quality.
exercises.explanation: False. Fresh means new and good quality.

exercises.question: What is the opposite of fresh?
exercises.explanation: Stale is the opposite of fresh.

exercises.question: This bread is _____. It's not fresh anymore. (stale)
Which is NOT correct?
exercises.explanation: Fresh and stale are opposites, can't be together.

exercises.question: Order: waitress / The / water / us / brought
A dish can mean both food and a plate.
What is a general word for breakfast, lunch, or dinner?
exercises.explanation: A meal is any eating occasion.

exercises.question: Enjoy your _____! (meal)
exercises.explanation: A common phrase when serving food.

exercises.question: Complete: three _____ a day
exercises.explanation: 'Three meals a day' is a common expression.

exercises.question: Which word has the shortest vowel sound?
Order: snack / I / between / need / meals / a
exercises.answer: I need a snack between meals.

exercises.question: What did you have for lanch?
exercises.answer: What did you have for lunch?

exercises.question: 식사 사이에 간식이 필요해요.
answer: I need a snack between meals.

exercises.question: A buffet is more expensive than à la carte.
exercises.explanation: Not necessarily true. It depends on the restaurant.

exercises.question: When you choose items individually from the menu, you order _____.
exercises.explanation: À la carte means individual item ordering.

exercises.question: The hotel has a breakfast _____. You can eat as much as you want. (buffet)
Which word is pronounced with a French accent?
exercises.explanation: À la carte is French: /ɑː lɑː kɑːrt/.

exercises.question: Would you like a side dich with that?
exercises.answer: Would you like a side dish with that?

exercises.question: The soup of the day is tomato soup.
Soup and salad are both liquid foods.
exercises.explanation: False. Only soup is liquid; salad is solid.

exercises.question: What do you put on salad to add flavor?
exercises.explanation: Salad dressing or sauce adds flavor.

exercises.question: I'll have a Caesar _____. (salad)
exercises.explanation: Caesar salad is a popular dish.

exercises.question: Order: extra / Can / have / I / sauce
exercises.explanation: Making a request at a restaurant.

exercises.question: Flavor and taste mean exactly the same thing.
exercises.explanation: True. They are synonyms for how food tastes.

exercises.question: Which describes food that is too hot with spices?
Order: to / like / Would / taste / you / wine / this
exercises.answer: Would you like to taste this wine?

exercises.question: The food is too bland. It needs salts.
exercises.answer: The food is too bland. It needs salt.

exercises.question: 음식이 너무 밍밍해요. 소금이 필요해요.
answer: The food is too bland. It needs salt.
This is too bland. It needs salt.

exercises.question: A reservation guarantees you a table at a restaurant.
exercises.explanation: True. A reservation is a booking in advance.

exercises.question: What do you call the person who cooks in a restaurant?
exercises.explanation: A chef is the professional cook.

exercises.question: I have a _____ for two at 8 PM. (reservation)
exercises.explanation: A reservation is an advance table booking.

exercises.question: Complete: make a _____
exercises.explanation: 'Make a reservation' is the correct phrase.

exercises.question: Order: chef / special / prepared / The / a / dish
exercises.answer: The chef prepared a special dish.

exercises.question: Would you like an apetizer?
exercises.explanation: The correct spelling is 'appetizer' with double 'p'.

exercises.question: 메인 요리로 스테이크 주세요.
answer: For the main course, I'll have steak.
I'll have steak for the main course.

exercises.question: The chocolate cake is our best dessert.
Beverage is another word for drink.
exercises.explanation: True. Beverage means any kind of drink.

exercises.question: What do you ask for when you want to pay?
exercises.explanation: The bill shows what you need to pay.

exercises.question: What _____ would you like? Coffee or tea? (beverage)
exercises.explanation: Beverage is a formal word for drink.

exercises.question: Complete: Can I have the _____, please?
exercises.explanation: Both 'bill' and 'check' are used for payment.

exercises.question: The portions here is very big.
exercises.answer: The portions here are very big.
exercises.explanation: Portions is plural, so use 'are' not 'is'.

exercises.question: 여기 음식 양이 매우 많습니다.
answer: The portions here are very big.
The portions here are very large.

exercises.question: Takeout and delivery are the same thing.
exercises.explanation: False. Takeout you pick up; delivery brings to you.

exercises.question: What contains information about food components?
exercises.explanation: Ingredients are the items used to make food.

exercises.question: I'd like this for _____. I'll take it home. (takeout)
exercises.explanation: Takeout means food to take away.

exercises.question: Complete: What _____ are in this dish?
Which word has the stress on the second syllable?
Order: medium / like / I'd / steak / my / well-done
exercises.explanation: Note: 'medium' was a distractor. The answer uses 'well-done'.

exercises.question: What do you ask for when your drink is empty?
exercises.explanation: A refill means filling your drink again.

exercises.question: What do you _____? I need help choosing. (recommend)
exercises.explanation: Asking for a recommendation at a restaurant.
